img.div: April Medford and Christie Bell are presented checks from Knights of Columbus. Both teachers wrote grants for instructional projects for students with special needs.
Board Appreciation and Board signs ethics agreement!
Heart of a Wildcat - Nora Wolfe
Congratulations Kristen Gibert, District Teacher of the Year!
Current Board of Trustees: L to R Houston Matthews, Ray Jackson, Ray A. Pilgrim, Dr. Bryan Green & Jeff Chapman
Ray Jackson was recognized for completing South Carolina School Boards Association Boardsmanship Institute Level 1 certification.
SC Pass maximum Scorer in Science Roeyn, Olivia, Julia and Caroline. Duke TIP Scholar/SC Junior Scholar Barbee Ruth

div.div:
• Children are our first priority in all decision making processes.
• All children should have equal access to a quality education addressing their individual needs.
• Children deserve the services of highly qualified instructional and support service personnel.
• Students benefit from a safe, orderly facility where a learning environment of mutual respect for diversity thrives.
• Stakeholder involvement from parents, community, and businesses partnerships ensures student success.
• All students will learn to read on grade level by the end of third grade and from fourth grade to high school read to learn content required to be college and career ready as required in South Carolina Read to Succeed legislation.
• Students will be college and career ready when graduating from high school.
• Each district employee is a valuable asset in educating children.
• Students learn best when they feel valued and their needs are met.

address.aria-label: Address for Greenwood County School District 52
Phone number for Greenwood County School District 52

span.data-emptytext: Greenwood County School District 52 provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment
span.data-value: NonDiscrimination Policy- It shall be the policy of the Greenwood School District #52 Public Schools not to discriminate on the basis of religion, race, national origin, sex, or handicap in educational programs, activities, or services. Students shall have an equal opportunity to participate in and benefit from all academic and extracurricular activities and services. Contact Cathy Anderson Greenwood District 52 Title IX coordinator 864-543-3100

p.span: NonDiscrimination Policy- It shall be the policy of the Greenwood School District #52 Public Schools not to discriminate on the basis of religion, race, national origin, sex, or handicap in educational programs, activities, or services. Students shall have an equal opportunity to participate in and benefit from all academic and extracurricular activities and services. Contact Cathy Anderson Greenwood District 52 Title IX coordinator 864-543-3100

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
